√i1 'go'

present: [2.] éti  yánti etc. V.+  -ité  -iyate etc. B.+   -- [1.] áyate etc. V.+  ayati etc. AV1.?+   -- [4.] ī́yate etc.   -- -- iye  iyāte  ī́mahe  iyāná V.+  íyati  -iyánt  imi  aitat  yan  īyāná  īyámāna  īmahi  

perfect: iyā́ya  īyús etc. V.+  iyayitha  iyétha  iyátha   -- -ayāṃ  cakre E.+  

aorist: [1.] īyāt etc. B.+  iyāsam   -- [4.] aiṣṭa   -- [5.] āyiṣṭa  

future: [1.] eṣyáti etc. AV.+  eṣyáte etc. B.+  ayiṣyati etc. B.+   -- [2.] etā́ etc. B.+  

verbal: itá V.+  -īta  étum B.+  étave  étavaí  étos  itvā́  -ítya V.+  -īya  -áyya  áyase  ityaí  iyádhyai  -ā́yam  

secondary: passive: īyate   -- intensive: īyāyate   -- desiderative: ayiyiṣate  iyiṣati   -- causative: āyayati etc.  -āyyate  āpayati  āpayate etc.  āpipat  

derivatives: áya V.+  ayátha RV.S.  áyana V.+  -āya V.+  -āyin AV.+  -āyana AV.U.  āyú V.+  ā́yu V.+  ā́yus V.+  -āyuka B.  -it B.+  íti V.+  ití V.B.  -ityā́ V.B.  -ítvan V.  itvará RV.C.  -itha RV.  īti E.+  īya- RV.  -etu RV.  etavyá B.+  etṛ́ V.+  éma VS.  éman RV.  -eya E.+  éva V.B.  -āpin C.  -āpaka C.  -āpya C.  -āpana E.+  -āpayitṛ C.  -āyaka C.  -āyana E.  -ayitavya C.  -āyitavya C.  

The last three derivatives only with prati; the four preceding, only with adhi.

The forms most distinctly calling for the admission of a root-form ī are, in the older language, ī́mahe V.B. (common in RV.), īyām and īyāta and īyus B.U., īyāná SV. (all single occurrences); in the later language, -īta, īti, -īya (all rare or sporadic). The present-stem ī́ya is improperly called intensive.
